title: Sadio Mane reveals Mohamed Salah’s ‘strange reaction’ in Liverpool dressing room after row
text:
Sadio Mane was furious with Mohamed Salah’s refusal to pass during Liverpool’s victory at Burnley (Picture: Getty)

Sadio Mane insists his row with Mohamed Salah during Liverpool’s 3-0 win over Burnley was simply a misunderstanding – but he admits the Egyptian’s reaction in the dressing room was ‘strange’.

Salah infuriated Mane by refusing to play him through on goal towards the end of a one-sided Premier League match at Turf Moor back at the end August.

The Senegalese forward exploded with anger on the bench after being replaced in the 85th minute and had to be calmed down by team-mates Joe Gomez, Roberto Firmino and James Milner.

Jurgen Klopp and Jordan Henderson both played down the altercation in the immediate aftermath of the victory and Mane has since made light of the incident.

Mane had to be calmed down in on the Liverpool bench (Picture: Getty)

‘It was a misunderstanding. I just wanted to help the team,’ Mane explained in an interview with Canal Plus Sport.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘You look at teams like City, they sometimes score five or six. If there’s a possibility to kill off the game as quickly as possible all the while trying to score many goals, I think that’s important, and so I was a bit frustrated.

‘We just talked, and everything was like before. We talked between ourselves, and then the manager called me into his office and we spoke. I told him it was already sorted and he was pleasantly surprised.’

For the first time, Mane has lifted the lid on Salah’s ‘strange’ reaction and revealed details of their conversation in the dressing room.

Mane continued: ‘He told me “But Sadio, why are you angry?” and I told him “You needed to give me the ball, Mo”, to which he replied “I didn’t see you. You know I’ve got nothing against you”.

‘I knew that, but his reaction was a bit strange to me.

‘We’re always side by side. He’s 10 and I’m 11. We text each other sometimes. We even talk on the phone, but we don’t have a problem.’

Liverpool midfielder Wijnaldum revelled in taking he mickey (Picture: Getty)

Mane has revealed that the rest of Liverpool’s squad mocked him and Salah over the row and Gini Wijnaldum acted as chief mickey-taker.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Everyone was taking the p*** out of us,’ the former Southampton attacker added.

‘Wijnaldum, who likes to tease people, waited until everyone was there, came up to me and asked out loud “Mo Salah, why did Mane want to hit you?”

‘The whole team started laughing.’
